metadata.title: CVE-2017-5034 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A use after free in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.98 for Linuxand Windows allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memoryread via a crafted PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5034` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172').
